Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2024
Data: This product is great it works with my HVAC system to get the most out of it. I really like that I can control it from my phone.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2024
Data: Connects easily to our existing Google Nest system. Installation was easy and only took a few minutes. Make sure you understand your existing wiring before you start and this is an easy replacement for your existing thermostat. Being able to adjust settings ing the Google home program makes it very convenient to use.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2024
Data:
Everything about this thermostat is a downgrade from the other Nest thermostats. I have had every version of the Nest thermostat and this one is the worst.

1) The controls are less intuitive. The spinning wheel is what made the Nest thermostat so easy to use and is the reason why the circle shape worked. If you remove the spinning to navigate the thermostat, what is the point of it being round like this? Instead, you have to use a touch-sensitive panel on the side which uses swipe and tap gestures. It sucks.

2) The app is a downgrade. You can no longer use the more intuitive Nest app. You have to use the Google Home app with this thermostat which requires more taps and searching through menus for simple control.

3) The colors are pretty, but it actually looks cheaper than the Nest Learning Thermostat or Nest Thermostat E. In my opinion, the best looking and most functional model was the E, which they have discontinued for reasons which baffle me.

5) I guess when we received it the battery was very low. It's been months of seeing "Very Low Battery" on the screen. Yes, I will replace the battery (a AAA), but it should come with a battery that has some charge. Not a good luck to ship things which, when first powered on, immediately says the battery needs to be replaced. Besides, if it's Low Battery as the screen has indicated for months now... why is it continuing to operate for this long?

Sadly, we will be looking to other brands for thermostats once we finally get frustrated enough with this one. Besides, Google sells your personal data and profits from it. Best I avoid supporting that in the future anyways: and so should you.

I recommend passing on the Nest Thermostat if you like simplicity, function, and style.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2022
Data:
I replaced and existing Wi-fi Enabled Honeywell that never worked very well. Overall the Nest Thermostat it’s a very positive upgrade : better aesthetics , better UI and much better “smart” features meaning i am saving money right away.

If you are a Google Home / Nest user then there is a lot of added value due to the automation and reporting features . The home and away detection using Google Home App works well to reduce usage while you are away from home. the daily reporting helps you estimate your bill. and the scenario-based scheduling gives you useful control over heating to balance comfort and usage

There are some failures though . the initial wire detection failed , i believe due to firmware issues . also my furnace has a semi automated fan, so the green wire detection failed while the timed fan was enabled . after 3 iterations the setup completed fine and the unit has been working great . Once active, my furnace now cycles less frequently which reduces noise in the house

the device UX is great but not intuitive for guests . yet another “one click does everything “ UI that takes time to understand . This could be good if you don’t want guests to fiddle

Finally, the Google HOME UI is very clumsy for basic features like setting schedules and reading the temperature . the app has too many features and functions that get in the way of basic thermostat usage . I recommend commanding via google assistant or setting hold temperature via the Device UI. Once you set a schedule , you won’t be adjusting temps often so it’s a minor hindrance .

Overall it’s a very positive purchase and with the rebate and cost savings you’ll save at least $100 in the first year . It’s a classy device —easily the best looking Thermostat on the market with the glossy mirrored finish and high contrast display .

All in I highly recommend it with some reservations that will likely be cleaned up with software revisions . If you are eligible for a rebate or a heavy Google user, it’s an obvious upgrade to pursue

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2024
Data: These have been a game changer for us! I always have my air con on a schedule but life has been busy and I found that often more than not we weren’t in the house when the air con was scheduled to run. After lots of research I settled on nest and the functionality of being able to override the air con and adjust temperatures from my phone has been AMAZING! Bills have reduced slightly as a result of this so I’m very happy with my purchase!

Data:
You will need to download the Google Home app; which I already had.
Very easy to install. Instructions are clear. Very small and attractive unit compared to the standard large AC controls!

Data:

My advice. Do not pay someone to put this in your house. It’s to easy to do. Follow the instructions.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2024
Data: not that friendly to operate the panel by hand. The device can not twist or tab, not the same as the black one, the only place to operate is the censor bar on right hand side. That operation is not smooth, and really gives me a hard time. Just use App now.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2024
Data:
Instal was very easy and was able to link to Alexa home system. Not positive how much it will save us but already finding the air conditioner is not running as much as before. I am not a very big fan of how to adjust, having a touch sensor on the side rather than turning it.

I recommend getting a wall plate too as it takes up less surface area than most traditional thermostats

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
Data:
I have an AC and heat pump with backup heat. This thermostat doesn’t support backup/emergency heat which I didn’t know when I bought it. Still works for heat and AC but if you want the assurance of everything hooked up then you’ll need the “learning thermostat” version.
Pros:
Good home/away sensing and easy to use in the Google home app. One tap enrollment in electric supplier rebates.
Cons:
Terrible controls on the actually thermostat. They couldn’t have picked a worse interaction method than sliding and tapping the side. Please just put buttons or an actually moving ring smh. But I usually just use my phone or Google home to adjust it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2024
Data:
The theromstat itself is great. Easy to hook up and get up and running. Very easy to use.
The only problem is the app control. You have to use Google home app to work it, which is fine but Google home does not refresh every time you open the app. Even with background app refresh on the app opens to its last settings of temperatures. You have to close the app and reopen it everytime to get it to update the current settings and temps. There is a Google nest app but that app is not compatible with this Google nest product. That makes no sense. Both Google nest thermostat and the app are made by Google and supported by Google yet the Google nest app does not work this thermostat. A dedicated app to the nest unit would be nice instead of having to use Google home app which is an overall app and not dedicated to the nest unit. Google home needs to refresh when you open the app

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2024
Data: I enjoy having the app to control from anywhere, but it was kind of tricky to install, it was too much for me to understand so I had to make my husband do it. lol I also don't think I'm very tech-savvy so I have a hard time figuring out how to operate it on the nest itself but I'm able to figure it out on the app. Also if anyone has tips on covering up the holes I would love to hear them! I think I can order an additional part to cover it up but I have no idea honestly.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2022
Data:
I really liked the presentation of this device, it is clean and well built, although the software is atrocious. Google Home is so convoluted that make you feel an idiot because all you want to do is set up the thermostat temperature range.

By default the device require wifi to even activate; but the process is simple. Overall you will have hard time depending if your AC/heater has the blue wire or not (which is the one carrying the power from what I can understand reading comments online). This device has its own set of batteries but I had hard time setting up my system because it was complaining that a wire was not set (yellow; which was set); so reading online I found that the software require the blue wire connected/shorted to be physically connected to the device, for the system to work. Please check online about this issue and you will find very detailed instructions about how to solve it.

Clearly the issue is purely on the software side: the app ask you to tell how many wires you have, so you need to connect the blue wire but tell the app you do not have it connected; and magically the thermostat will work. YMMV depending on your AC/heater system of course; they have different number of wires so check with someone knowledgeable.

Other than that; setting up a simple range of temp for the whole day was a challenge, because this thing is so smart that it think that you need 4 different setup for different time of the day, as if you want to keep your temperature constant. After a lot of jumps and hoops, I was able to keep the bloody thing in a range where it turn on only when it is too hot or too cold, and stay off the rest of the time.

Also not sure why the option to set a range is disabled by default, but I assume it is because people use those for AC only and not for heating and AC combo? My system has a combo for AC and heater so I needed the setting that turn on heater when too cold, and AC when too hot; and had to dig in the settings to change this, while it should be a simple option right on the main app page.

The controls on the unit are OK; there are no buttons and the screen is not touch screen, you have a strip on the right side which is hard to use unless you got some sort of dexterity or your fingertips are super conductive I guess. I am a tech person for living and this interface was quite weird to handle; would rather have 3 buttons to do everything instead of the strip but once you know how to handle the device, it is usable.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
Data: Our HVAC tech told us to buy this when our Honeywell thermostat bit the dust. It's been a nightmare. We live in a hot and humid climate and no matter what we do, this thermostat keeps resetting itself to 82 degrees randomly. We've gone to every online forum we can find to figure out how to keep it from doing this and discovered that everyone has the same problem. So we have to constantly check it if we want our house cooler than 82 degrees - which we absolutely do. We sleep at 68 degrees and live at 72-75 degrees. It's very hard on your HVAC system to vary more than 3-5 degrees throughout the day so this is less than ideal. We do NOT recommend. We are having Honeywell thermostats reinstalled. Their app is easy to use and understand none of this nonsense.

Profile Name: Tiene problema con el Wifi se desconecta en algunos momentos ya probé Mi wifi con otros dispositivos y todo bien
Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2024
Data: No hay fan-auto ,solo se configura con Google home antes no era así,las batería defectuosas desde el primer día no puedes compartir el termostato para más de 5 personas ,en mi oficina o comercio no se puede utilizar porque todas sus funciones y explicaciones son para una casa osea uso residencial no comercial

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2024
Data: I'd give the installation instructions and thermostat a passing grade but Google makes you install the Nest app and then the Home App and if you want to use the Alexa app, you need to go through several steps which I tried and could still not link it to Alexa. I'm kind of a techno neard and I have installed many devices and few were this frustrating. I am returning the Nest and will be installing the Amazon Thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
Data:
This thermostat is excellent when integrated with Google Home. Using the new script editor feature, we have nearly full control over the settings based on any trigger we like.

The in-app temperature scheduling works well.

The only thing missing is full control over the fan. The fan scheduling options are limited to running it every day, between a start and end time, and running it for a specific duration in each hour. For example, you can schedule it between 2pm to 8pm by running it for 15 minutes every hour, or for "60 minutes every hour", which basically enables it full-time.

The fan cannot be enabled or disabled with automation so there's no ability to:

- Turn off the fan when home presence is away.
- Enable the fan when home presence is home.
- Enable the fan when upstairs is much hotter than downstairs.
- Etc.

The fan can be manually turned on or turned on via the app, but it has to be for a specific amount of time, like 30 minutes, 8 hours, etc.

We've accepted that we will have to manage the fan ourselves by manually turning it on when needed.

Overall, a great product that is really cheap when combined with rebates. It would be excellent if it supported better control on the fan.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2023
Data: I was a little surprise when I got my Nest. I did a search for the e-nest which is one down from the top of the line. This is what came up in my search. But it's not what I got. I got the bottom line basic nest unit. It works pretty well does everything it is supposed to but it does not have all the bells and whistles of the two more expensive thermostats. One you cannot turn the bezel to adjust the temperature, you must sweep your finger along a line on the side. It works, but I did not expect this. Second when doing the installation it's pretty straightforward but I could not find an installation for this model. All the Google Home installation directions took me to the Top Line or the one lesser model. Also this does not come with a bezel plate for behind it. Unless your wall is pristine with a hole no bigger than about an inch and a half across you are going to have to put an escutcheon plate behind the mounting bracket. Not a problem, just a surprise. Also I ran into a couple of configuration issues when doing the self test however I just pushed Skip and everything worked. Overall it wasn't too difficult just a bit surprising.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
Data:
Initial install
It went well other then when it came to adding to the google home app. The google home app kept failing to add it.

Batteries:
After two months of use I've had a couple power outages and each time it says batteries low this last time I took it off the wall. I looked at the batteries they say google on them they also say not rechargeable alkaline. Why have non rechargeable batteries seems like a engineering flaw. It couldn't have brought up the cost to make it charge after all the older Nest stuff did.

Google App:
Forces you to use google home instead of nest. if you ever had one of the older nest thermostats you will miss the nest app.

Things you cant do on this thermostat
Nest App: better scheduling also allowed you to login to the nest webpage to make changes.
Older nest thermostats allowed you to lock the physical to a temp range to keep the kids from getting ridiculous.

Other then the setup problems and the battery problems the product function as it should.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
Data: No wall plate included. Luckily had also ordered a new rotary tool so I made one. Easy install and works great. All the functions are accessed from the side of the device and I have to show everyone because they expect it to be touchscreen or rotary like previous models. Also, it does not accept remote thermometers. Just pay attention to the different models. I had to migrate my old nest over to Google so see them both on the same app. That was a 2 hour process. Have a beer and some patience nearby.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
Data: I purchased this a while ago and realized I could not install it myself and that I needed an electrician to do so. My home was built in 1958 and I have had some updates to my wiring, but this one cost me a pretty penny to get installed. Now that it’s in, I appreciate the design, but I’m not sure it’s that much better than the Honeywell that I had that was costing me nothing. We’ll see how we do in the winter and I may update this review.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2024
Data: Installation was simple. Being able to set routines and customize the to individual days of the week is great. And if your schedule changes just open the app adjust the thermostat and when you get home the temperature is perfect.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
Data: This thermostat is easy to install. I elected to have a local HVAC specialist install it for me. Cost was $100. The thermostat is simple to install and there are help videos for installation. My thermostat worked fine as a thermostat, but neither I nor the HVAC installer could get the Nest Thermostat to connect to WIFI or to the Google Home App. The installer said this Nest Thermostat and the Google Home App that controls it are finnicky and he's had lots of calls for help to get them to work on the App. He said he could come back in a few days for no charge and spend more time trying to get the App to connect to the Nest Thermostat. I decided to return this one and buy a better Smart Thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2024
Data:
This thing was a major pain to install. You need to hire someone that really really knows about these things. Lots of wires and it took me 3 different people before I actually got it working. And the heater still only works on emergency heat and there is no option to have the system just circulate the air like my last Thermostat did

And because it took me 3 installers to get it working, I missed the window to get the rebate that I was supposed to get from my utility company.. which is the only reason I purchased it.. and I hate it.

It only gets 2 stars because at least I can control it from my phone and monitor usage.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
Data: I purchased this one for my boyfriend for this coming Christmas. He has been pining after one since he sees the ease and functionality that mine provides. I can shut my a/c off if I forgot when I left the house, and conversely I can turn it on before I return home. There is a weekly schedule that you can program temperatures to change at different times of the day if you wish to leave the system on, yet keep the output at minimum usage. I love that there are different colors now, too. Too late for me, I have basic black, but ordered the grey for him-I'm sure he will love it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
Data:
The installation process was horrible. I felt bad my HVAC guy had to sit around for an hour just trying to figure out how to connect this thing to wifi.

The Google Home app freezes constantly and has glitches. This is really frustrating at times when you actually need an adjustment of temp.

The device looks nice and is fun to tap, but it’s not easy to use and takes some time to figure out.

I like the schedules you can set up and how you can add favorites like “home” “away” traveling” “sleep” “etc”. But I COULD NOT figure out how to turn my thermostat off when I was out of town for 2 weeks in the middle of summer which was very frustrating given no one needed my house to be cooled.

It’s a nice product but if I were to do this again, I would probably choose a more user friendly thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
Data: Although I had a little difficulty installing, I like being able to control this from an all. It looks sleek on the wall and allows us to create the heating and cooling schedules we need.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2022
Data: I was dreading installing this. Thought to myself - I am handy but am I that handy?! Was putting off purchasing because I was thinking install would be a nightmare! Electric and plumbing - both Ararat’s make me pause… My house was built in 2016 so not that old. I have no idea how much harder install it like be if you own an older home. Picture of the inside of my old Honeywell thermostat is attached / one of those just regular standard thermostats. I did check comparability prior to purchase - seemed ok. I read the instructions first and followed them precisely! And it was easy actually. Took about 30 minutes which included taking the old one off as well. Works great as expected / anticipated / described. Word of advice- do this in the day time and good lighting. Or have someone hold a flashlight while you are installing. You are going to be turning off the power prior to the install, so you need another source of light to see what you are doing. All in all good experience so far. I need to patch up a small hole where the old thermostat was but not a big deal - see picture. Recommend purchasing. And I think this is my longest review ever. Maybe lol.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2024
Data: Controlling the nest from the product itself is hit and miss. The tap and slide method doesn't always work. Usually it takes 2 or 3 tries. Rarely do i get where I want to go on the first attempt. I try to use the app which is much more responsive.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2023
Data:
I am upgrading from a gen 2 Nest that died and just will not turn on. I am beyond amazed how easy it was to install this new one. I do have a “Blue C Common” wire that I had installed for the Gen 2 as it would battery drain all the time. This screen is super bright FYI, don’t let the mirror fool you it’s very clear and bright!

This new one was installed, firmware updated, up and running no lie in like 15 minutes, I am a little disappointed it was so easy as my wife looked at me and said “that’s it ?” If you’re wondering this is the Fog Color and my wall is painted Sherwin Williams “Anew Gray” and they pair well together.

We have a few nest cameras around the house and it’s good to now be able to use the same home app for everything.

I am glad I took advantage of this sale, couldn’t be happier with the new Thermostat!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
Data: This looks smart on the wall and just give me peace of mind when I am a way that I can adjust my heat. It is a little tricky to figure out the side mechanism when you are in the house and you want to adjust it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2024
Data: After multiple nest learning thermostats WiFi modules failed. I replaced with this lower end model and it outperforms the learning 100 times over. Love the WiFi feature and being able to change temp from my phone.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
Data: It is indeed very practical once you have connected to wifi; you can change the temp manually in case the wifi fails which is very practical. However, when one tries to decipher technical support, it becomes a nightmare, as they have different types of thermostats and mine did NOT specify the correct term, so I simply got a technician to do it for me ($70) sigh!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
Data: I love this unit where I can set the hot and cold together and do it all on my phone just wish the batter's would be used as a back up if you lose power not something changed frequently

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2024
Data: Was easy to install. The step by step installation guide on the app makes it very easy. What is good is when there is a problem with the havac system the app can notify you and help diagnose the problem. I did not like the eco mode but it can be disabled through the app. Works well with other google devices and fast response time.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2024
Data: We purchased two of these for our new home to replace Honeywell thermostats that we thought were difficult. After three hours of attempting to program through the app on our phones, we finally had to wait for our son to come visit so he could install them. He is extremely tech savvy and it took him two hours to load onto one phone. We would like to have had them on two phones but apparently that is not an option. After YouTube videos and about two hours, I managed to set a schedule for the winter with the heat coming on at certain time and going off at a certain time. We have now switched into spring, and are in need of some AC and after again, hours of struggling through the app on our phone, and YouTube videos, no matter what we set one of our ACs to it kept coming on heat, even though we had it on the cool setting and at 70. It was 76° in the house so it should’ve cooled but instead it just kept giving us heat. We finally just shut the breaker off for that AC so that our house wouldn’t be 80° before we had company arriving. Yesterday we removed it and put the Honeywell back in, and are very glad of it simplicity. My advice is that these are not very user-friendly at all. Unfortunately, we are two months past our return date so an expensive lesson. Hope this helps you not make the same mistake that we did.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
Data: Great smart thermostat option! I have it in my detached garage and use it with a propane ceiling heater. You can adjust the heat from an app on your phone and set an energy saver mode. I have it set to turn on if the temperature drops below 35 to make sure nothing in the garage freezes and once it reaches temp it automatically turns off. Easy to program, highly recommend!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
Data:
My biggest issue with this thermostat is that it does not support any features that will set an allowable temperature range that can be set, or a temperature lock feature. So it if very easy for a guest or a malicious actor to abuse your home’s HVAC system. Even my dusty old honeywell thermostat had this capability.

Otherwise it is a decent thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024
Data: Absolutely crazy, but if you are hoping to keep using your Nest App dont get this Nest thermostat. You have to use google home. Crazy. Other than that its beautiful, easy to set up (in google home) and works as expected. But sheesh, unreal you cant use the app.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
Data: It's a nice product but I have to ding it a couple of stars because after changing the password to my network the thermostat became disconnected. You would think it would be relatively straightforward to reconnect with the app. This is after all a Google product and surely they can design a simple way to reconnect a device to a wifi network. Surprisingly this is not the case. You have to remove the device from the app, rescan the QR, and then navigate to the wifi setup. Obviously this is not optimal but in my case even this didn't work and I had to do a factory reset before being able to reconnect to my network. In addition to the frustration and lost time all the thermostat usage data was lost. So if you don't think you'll ever be changing your wifi password this is close to a five star product but otherwise it's around three stars at best.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2021
Data:
I will preface this all by saying I’m not a professional, I can’t fix anything, and I have a 13 year old basic home. My dad still does most of my fix-it stuff for me. But I did this on my own!

My only complaint is that the test on Google said my system was compatible and then when I went to install it, it said it wasn’t. Once I figured out that my system was pretty basic (yellow line was also labeled as W2, no O/B labeled but used the B line for O/B) it helped to just fudge a little and it works like a charm! I attached a photo of my setup before so know if it’s like this, the Nest will work!

Love that I can now schedule Sleep, Home, and Away temps without having to physically be near my thermostat. Moving into the 21st century just got easier!

Data: This is not user friendly and kind of does whatever it wants. Spend the money and get the more expensive Nest Thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2023
Data:
I love the concept but the interface is frustrating. The actual temp is in tiny print underneath the preset temp. Makes no sense. Would think the actual temp should be the dominant one.

Takes awhile for it to register my presence to illuminate. Find myself constantly waving my hand in front of it to activate it.

Not my favorite product. I'm now in the process of getting a replacement since it's under warranty.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2021
Data: Extremely easy to install. Sleek and modern look. My only issue is you loose some of the features that my previous "learning" thermostat included. Such as the ability to lock the thermostat, use it with the nest app (only works in "Google Home") app, and of course the "learning" aspect. It does allow you to create temperature schedules, where you can have it set to a specific temperature set at specific times and save the schedule. It also coms with 3 premade ones such as "Balanced", "Comfort", etc. All in all it's nice looking and easy to use, just depends if those missing features are relevant to your life style or not.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
Data: Very easy to install and use. The app works great and you can share it with other people that have a google account. So you don’t have to share your single user name and password.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2024
Data: All is good. But pay attention to have c wire. otherwise batteries run out quite fast.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2023
Data: Bought a couple days ago. installed and battery already need replacement. other than that ok product. Plus. if you have problems connecting to Wifi in the beginning restart your thermostat

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2022
Data: I was excited to buy a Nest thermostat and install it. Installation wasn't too tough, but programming is a nightmare. This is a modern Generation X failure, absurdly complicated and impossible to program. When my every attempt to create a simple start, heat up, stop program failed, I called tech support. The guy I got clearly knew next to nothing about programming it; every time I asked a new question he put me on hold so he could look it up. The program he helped me create failed to do the simple tasks I wanted. Too many choices, zones, presets, just tech at its worst. I don't know why, but starting heating at 4:30 in the morning the office went from 56 degrees to 66 degrees in 5 hours. My maintenance guy put back the old Honeywell thermostat and this morning it was already at 72 degrees after an hour and a half. I will gladly give up the remote feature to have a properly warmed office.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2024
Data: Product is easy to install however, connects to wifi once and then disconnects. Tried resetting it 3 times to factory reset and problem still persist. Looked up YouTube videos and appears this is a common problem. Will work without connecting to your phone but this is one of the features you want if you have a smart thermostat. Ended up returning and installing original thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2024
Data:
My AC doesn't natively have a control wire. I bought a 24 adapter, wired it up, eventually got it working. Then after an hour, it started reading 10 degrees hotter than it actually was. Then 20 degrees hotter. I had this same problem with another Nest thermostat, and pulling the batteries fixed it (for a while). I pulled the batteries of this unit, then it wouldn't reconnect to wifi. Overnight, it ran and ran and ran and I woke up to 60F house instead of the normal 70F.

If you have two separate systems for AC and Heat, you need two Nest (so I've wasted money twice); and you need to create different locations in the Google Home app because I guess you can't have two Nest thermostats in the same location for some reason.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
Data:
The physical install was a breeze. The login / software set up took two hours on the phone with tech support. it was MISERABLE. Google fix your stuff and stop breaking stuff that already works.

additionally The new physical controls are not great at all. I will not buy another nest.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2022
Data: The device works well with the app, but the physical interface is terrible. You have to touch the right side of the unit to bring up the menu, then slide/tap to navigate the menu, which is clunky at best. The tap function works 5% of the time, and nothing about the interface is intuitive. Terrible design. Plus when I tell Alexa to change the temperature, she adjusts the whole heat/cool range rather than just the setting I intended. My previous Trane unit handled this perfectly. Guess Google has some catching up to do to match Trane.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2024
Data:
This thermostat is very difficult to set up since there is some kind of software bug that gives you an Error code 294 if you have 4 wires from the heater/AC (without C wire). After getting no help from Nest customer support I finally found a workaround on the Google Nest community website. The trick is to set the system up for 5 wire and then reset it when it complains that the C wire is missing.

I still have a problem with Home ans Away feature not working. After spending 2 hours on the phone with level 1 customer support I was promised a call back from level 2 support . It has been 3 days and the only response that I get every time I email them is someone is going to call you right back. But, of course, nobody does.

Horrible customer service!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2022
Data: The product works fine. But unless you have a C-WIRE your cooling will short cycle. This is in contrast to what is stated in the description as well as in the instructions with the Nest. Please be aware

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022
Data: Used this thermostat instead old analogue one. Doesn’t have so many setting like not the way how to adjusting delta of temp which will be using for on/off heater- cooling s by default it is 0.5F. Like if you set 70F it will start heating 69.5 and stopS when temp reaching 70. I cannot change this setting. May will look more expensive which have this possibility. Recently contacted support when have an issue with heater. They try to help but it is seems to be not so much help. It can do same as the analogue with days setting schedule. Benefits can control temp remotely.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022
Data: I have problems with the Google Home app constantly dropping the thermostat telling me it can't save changes, however, Alexa and Google Assistant are always connected to it in the house. I bought it so I can monitor it when I am away from the house but the Google home app drops it more than it will maintain the Nest thermostat in its app, thus I can't monitor it on my smartphone. I have rebooted the router, I've uninstalled and reinstalled the Google app and still it didn't work. I am tired of messing with this thermostat. If you like wasting your time on products that constantly need to be set up over and over again, than you will like this product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2024
Data: They come with a factory issue where they always show a Low Battery message even if hardwired to a C wire. Reached out for support and they say it needs to be charged using a USB, Google products are all coming with factory issues and they don’t repair/replace them.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
Data: I love the fact that I can start warming up my vacation home from my app so when I arrive it’s nice and cozy

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2024

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
Data: This is an amazing unit that I love that I can control from my phone and it was super easy to install in less than 5 minutes. I would buy the back piece at the same time because I didn’t and removing the old unit removed part of my wall so I will have to take it back down to add this.

Data: This was the perfect addition to remodeling our home. Love the fact that we can use it wirelessly from anywhere. Came with great instructions for installation.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2023
Data: Our old thermostat finally bit the dust. I researched several different ones and read reviews like always. It looks great on our wall and it is very simple to use. Works like a charm.

Turns on when it wants to doesn’t turn on when I want it on.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2022
Data:
My only quibble with it is the app can be confusing to use (definitely not an Apple product). The unit also defaults to a setting where it goes into "eco" mode if no one is detected in the house for a time, which meant my AC kept turning off in blistering heat and I'd come home to an 80 degree home. I had to turn off the motion sensor to fix that.

Otherwise, it's a good unit.

Data: N/A

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2024
Data: Two things that caused me to return this product in day 1: no fan control when unit is not in heat or cool mode. Also setup was a joke. It never recognized all of the connected wires. First it didn't recognize the red wire. I did it over and over, trimming and reinserting. Finally did a factory reset. Without doing a thing, now the red wire was recognized, but not the Common wire. This meant I couldn't even start the HVAC unit. Fiddled and fiddled with that to no avail. After a number of resets and retries with no success, I took it off the wall, packaged it back up, and asked for AA refund.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2021
Data: I just installed it but as of now I am disappointed. All that money to buy it and they couldn't even include a basic plastic trim base plate. How much would that have cost them, a dollar?....I used a piece of cardboard as a temporary trim plate to cover the hole because of course the Nest is smaller than the old thermostat.....One more thing. My old Nest had a ring I could turn to raise/lower the temperature, or find other features. This one you have to screw around with your finger, sliding it around the thermostat until you get lucky and find the feature you are looking for, like Settings, for example. I suppose I will get used to it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2023
Data: I have not received my refund o$99.00. Sent with the kit to install in same box and have been refunded that amount. Why have I not been refunded for the thermostat? Please respond asap. Thanks.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
Data: The new thermostats are not nearly as intuitive as the older models but work OK. You cannot lock out the thermostat which having children would have been a deal breaker for me had I known but by far the worst part is that you can't use the old Nest app which was really good, you must use Google Home which is one of the worst apps I have seen since the early 2000's. It's as if the app is still in beta testing. The only reason to purchase this thermostat is if you want a Wi-Fi thermostat but do not have a C-wire connection.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2023
Data: Love the color! Easy to install, I purchased a matching plate separately because the previous thermostat was a big rectangle and I didn’t feel like painting the wall. It takes a little effort to get used to it but becomes intuitive quick and can be controlled from your phone app.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2024
Data: The packaging was open and everything was just thrown in the box. The box was missing all of the installation hardware. It’s was clearly a returned item that somebody slopped in the box.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2024
Data:
Product focuses too much on being eco friendly and does not actually go to temperature set. IE I have it set to 72 and the house is 76 and it’s not even running.

You also can’t just have the fan on. You have to set it on for a timer AND you have to have AC or heat on to run the fan.

I would not buy again.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2022
Data: I've been using this for 4 months and STILL can't get the location-aware feature to work probably when my phone is home or leaves! I have to manually change the setting and it's obnoxious! The schedules work fine, but this is supposed to use my phone to know when I'm home (like on my day off) and it RARELY does -even with my walking by the thermostat, it usually takes around an hour for it to realize that it needs to change 😡🤦🏼‍♂️

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
Data: Bought this to replace an older thermostat and love it. Its so easy to use and like being able to change the thermostat with our phone.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2023
Data:
without a C wire it will not act as wifi controllable thermostat (well not after the battery runs down which is quick). google sells a conversion kit - BUT - you will need access to your HVAC unit itself to install that (not just the filter vent). not recommend as it misleading in saying C wire not needed - without it is works as a dumb digital thermostat.

*Update*
Did get the google power adapter (extra cost) to make this work. The side swipe control is very awkward and over sensitive - not at all like the full nest version rotating ring. The main issue is that this can only be control by google app on phone, no web option at all (and google no info that this not available just does not appear in google home web). *This does not work with the full function nest app / nest web* It is a cheap half-built solution. Given rebates abound, just go for the full function nest version that hosted by nest.com / nest app.

Changed rating to 1-star

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2022
Data: HD to default the first one. Second unit wasn't a problem except cooling wasn't setup had to go into the settings and add the wire for the cooling require the then the cooling showed up in the modes.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2024
Data: Wish I had something nice to say but this only lasted a year before I had to go a different route. It constantly disconnected from the WiFi and didn’t work on the app

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
Data: Our original ac sensor unit was giving out (buttons no longer worked). The Nest Thermostat was easy to install and has a beautiful aesthetic. Highly recommend buying a base plate to cover up where the original sensor unit rest.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2022
Data: I just set it and forget about it, it knows when I am away, lowers the temp and really saves a lot of money. I can turn it on remote have the house cold or warm before I arrive. I just love the intelligence in this product. Google is amazing! it also really looks nice as well.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2023
Data:
They redesigned the controls, there is a very counter intuitive control, is a slider touch sensitive on the right side, that you can't even see standing in front of it, so if you are a first time user, you should definitely read the stupid manual.

The control for the temperature and the menu, is a touch sensitive slider, people that have never encountered this design, have the hardest time using it, most of the time they give up, how do I know? Try running a rental unit with one of these, people won't stop calling you to figure out how to use the damn thing.

I hope whoever designed this gets fired, seriously.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2021
Data: Setup was a little daunting it said it wasn’t compatible with my system but I hooked it up anyway and it works fine. The nest app is useless everything is moving to google home app. No baseplate?

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2024
Data:
Everything about this thermostat is a downgrade from the other Nest thermostats. I have had every version of the Nest thermostat and this one is the worst.

1) The controls are less intuitive. The spinning wheel is what made the Nest thermostat so easy to use and is the reason why the circle shape worked. If you remove the spinning to navigate the thermostat, what is the point of it being round like this? Instead, you have to use a touch-sensitive panel on the side which uses swipe and tap gestures. It sucks.

2) The app is a downgrade. You can no longer use the more intuitive Nest app. You have to use the Google Home app with this thermostat which requires more taps and searching through menus for simple control.

3) The colors are pretty, but it actually looks cheaper than the Nest Learning Thermostat or Nest Thermostat E. In my opinion, the best looking and most functional model was the E, which they have discontinued for reasons which baffle me.

5) I guess when we received it the battery was very low. It's been months of seeing "Very Low Battery" on the screen. Yes, I will replace the battery (a AAA), but it should come with a battery that has some charge. Not a good luck to ship things which, when first powered on, immediately says the battery needs to be replaced. Besides, if it's Low Battery as the screen has indicated for months now... why is it continuing to operate for this long?

Sadly, we will be looking to other brands for thermostats once we finally get frustrated enough with this one. Besides, Google sells your personal data and profits from it. Best I avoid supporting that in the future anyways: and so should you.

I recommend passing on the Nest Thermostat if you like simplicity, function, and style.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2024
Data: We purchased two of these for our new home to replace Honeywell thermostats that we thought were difficult. After three hours of attempting to program through the app on our phones, we finally had to wait for our son to come visit so he could install them. He is extremely tech savvy and it took him two hours to load onto one phone. We would like to have had them on two phones but apparently that is not an option. After YouTube videos and about two hours, I managed to set a schedule for the winter with the heat coming on at certain time and going off at a certain time. We have now switched into spring, and are in need of some AC and after again, hours of struggling through the app on our phone, and YouTube videos, no matter what we set one of our ACs to it kept coming on heat, even though we had it on the cool setting and at 70. It was 76° in the house so it should’ve cooled but instead it just kept giving us heat. We finally just shut the breaker off for that AC so that our house wouldn’t be 80° before we had company arriving. Yesterday we removed it and put the Honeywell back in, and are very glad of it simplicity. My advice is that these are not very user-friendly at all. Unfortunately, we are two months past our return date so an expensive lesson. Hope this helps you not make the same mistake that we did.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2024
Data: We ordered this device and moved into our new home. With all the moving installing it wasn't a priority so we were outside the return window. We had an electrician come in and attempt to install it but our heater blew up and our AC broke. The thermostat kept showing an error and we had to have someone else come in to repair the ac. The second electrician also agreed that the device was defective and recommended we never order Google's thermostat products again since they tend not to interact well with ac units and can cause them to malfunction.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2024
Data: So far not at all impressed with this product. My old Casio looking thermostat kept the house much cooler. Difficult to operate, tried "googling" information. I've had thermostat set to 71 since 9 am, now 5 pm and hasn't gotten below 79 and shows 86% humidity in my house. Tried the cool to dry function, gave "internal error" message. Internet research showing that may not be an option for the model I have. Going to try to call in a professional to help, as I just had an electrician install it thinking I could operate it with the app. If not, going to return this product. May not be a good option for south Texas.

Ended up returning and installing original thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2024
Data: Bought 2 of these from Next 1 tech. One was great and one didn’t work properly. Seller wants a 20% restocking fee to return the defective nest thermostat. Beware, if they are restocking it, you may get the piece of junk they sold me!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2024
Data: I used the online compatibility checker and it said the system was compatible. It was more than a month before I got around to installing it and the google home app says it is not compatible. I tried installing it anyway but it heats in both cool and heat mode. I went back to the online compatibility checker and noticed it only checks for whether the system is compatible with the Nest Learning Thermostat. I have the Nest Programmable Thermostat. Now it is too late to return the thermostat. Frustrating.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2022
Data: I've had this particular Nest thermostat for almost 1 year now and it hasn't stayed connected to WiFi for a full 48-hours since my purchase. One may ask, "Why wait 1 year to write a review and provide feedback?" Well, it's because the thermostat does it's job and I really didnt want to disconnect it, re-install my old one, only to put in a new Nest when it arrived. And because it randomly connected to my WiFi today, only to last for about 2 hours, so that's why I'm writing review now. One of the biggest pros of having a smart thermostat, is the ability of accessing it online and adjusting the temperature from your bed or wherever you are. But this one hasn't stayed connected without me having to disconnect it and basically re-install it (minus the re-wiring). My WiFi strength is great, never have had any issues with any of my other electronic items, only the Nest. So with all of the troubleshooting and lack of help from tech support, I'm giving it 1 star. Next time, I'm buying brand new. I've had a Nest thermostat before, but it was a new purchase, not used or refurbished. Lesson learned.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2024
Data: Wow! Incredible sleek product that will crap out and make you question the integrity of your own electrical system, when in fact it’s been the shoddy rushed and terrible software of this unit.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2024
Data: It was hard to install. I had to have 2 separate technicians come out to install it. During the winter it worked great but it would not connect to my ac during warmer weather and it was cheaper to get rid of it then to pay someone else to come out and to try and fix it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2024
Data: Difficult to get around app and humidity sensor is wrong by 19%

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2023
Data: If I could give it a Zero Star review I would. Bought this to replace a Nest that failed after 10 years. It’s not easy to install. We didn’t have a C wire. Researched how to videos and instructions on the web. Nothing worked. So a few weeks later we hired an electrician to install one and install this new Nest….well, long story short he added a C wire and installed the Nest and it still didn’t work. Can’t return it I guess because it’s been taken out of the box. So we wasted ~$120 and can’t qualify for any energy rebate. Expensive mistake. Not sure I will ever trust Google products again. The only positive thing I can say is it looks pretty — you have to touch the thermostat to see the temperature which I don’t think is convenient.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2023
Data: After finally getting my apple account activated so I could download the Google Home app then reactivating my google account then filling out a bunch of info for the google home app I was ready to begin installation. The instructions using the app were easy enough but annoying. I’m a bit old fashioned and would have preferred a simple set of paper instructions rather than trying to page back and forth with an app. Anyway… after trying several different thermostat wiring configurations per the app instructions i finally gave up and came to the conclusion as per the app instructions that it won’t work without running another power wire. Not gonna tear my house apart to do that. Very frustrating after wasting a day. It’s going back. I’ll be happy going with a new simple programmable but non wi-fi and non complex thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
Data: I have been a Nest user for over a decade. All in on Nest products. I have installed tons of Nest Thermostats. This is garbage. Absolute disaster. First off, it doesn't work with the Nest app. You need this functionality, the Google Home app is a train wreck and nothing like the Nest app. Next, the adjustability is trash. You have to slide your finger on a small strip on the right side of the thermostat. No rotating ring, cant touch anywhere but a tiny 1 inch strip on the right. The screen is abysmally small. I returned it so I could pay more money for the *real* Nest Thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2024
Data: ordered new.Covered in fingerprints hair & seals were already broken.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2023
Data: I have had Nest thermostats in the past and have had good luck with them, which is why I was buying another. I used the compatibility checker to make sure it would work with the wiring in my condominium. It said I was compatible. So I made the purchase. When I went to do the installation I came to find it was not compatible. Support for something a little tricky is non existent. If you want a Nest I guess all you can do is the best you can before making the purchase. If it doesn't work send it back for your refund. Your loss is your time, and some frustration.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2024
Data: I bought 9 of these for my new house. All has dwad batteries. I had to buy charger because c cable cannot charge dead batteries. Charger is not charging too. I have to buy new batteries

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2023
Data: I have a two wire 24V heating system and wanted the Nest 3rd Generation or Nest E. I thought this was it because in the description it said it worked without a C "Common" Wire. Easy return so nothing lost except time installing and uninstalling. Could have used it but I would have to install the or separate Nest Power Connector or 24volt transformer. I didn't want to run additional wires. There are lots of tutorials on You Tube on how to do it but this is an old house and pulling back the thermostat wire and running additional wire was problematic

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2023
Data: My router/modem died and my IP installed a new one. I tried to reset my Nest thermostat but it was totally unresponsive. Kept saying to update in the Google Home app but Google Home showed no way to do that. So I ordered a new Nest thermostat exactly like the first one from amazon.com and right out of the box it behaved exactly like the first one. I then tried to schedule a technician to come out, but the site did not recognize my email address. So I am not stuck with two Nest thermostats that are useless.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2023
Data:
So I had trouble setting up this thermostat

when origially installed in 10/22. It kept telling me there was am error, or no power. I finally got it set up by not saying I had on of the wires. Now months later, I had to update my internet, which means reconnecting the Nest. I just keeps telling me it is inable to safe my changes. I have erased and reenstalled the app as well as factory reset. This is just not worth all the work trying to set this up in the app. I have to manually adjust, should have just bought a cheap manual thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2023
Data:
I absolutely hate this product. I replaced my previous thermostat due to the previous owners having some lock on it controlled. I thought this would be a great way to stay on schedule and control it from my room so I don't walk down the hall and accidently wake up my child. Nope. The thing disconnects from the wifi daily. The router is next to the dang thermostat. There are no interferences as this is set to priority (thank you AT&T) and yet it still becomes disconnected. I have tonreconnect it continuously.

All the help topics state it's the modem, router or something of that relationship and we've done everything recommended and guess what? It still disconnects. I absolutely dispise this product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2021
Data:
I have experience with Nest products pre-google and I loved them. My old thermostat was great. This new one is awful. The plastic feels cheap, the display is unattractive, the lack of the click ring feels like a step in the wrong direction. But worse than the aesthetics is the actual function of the device itself. It constantly loses connection to my network (the only device in the house that does so). Every time it loses connection and disappears from the app, I have to go through the install procedure, remove it from the wall, scan the QR code, tell the app what wires I have, give it info about my system and wait for it to connect. This morning, I went through that procedure twice and it failed to connect both times.

I am to the point that I'm about to reconnect my old "dumb" thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2023
Data: It is hard to fathom the problems Google Nest has created with what should be a simple tool. A thermostat should not be so complicated, as to set itself to the wrong timezone. What is going when that happens? I suddenly had an appreciation for Apple, since they are a hardware company, they must do rigorous testing, versus Google, where I can't imagine why a thermostat would set itself to the wrong timezone (a problem still unresolved). I also experienced other inconveniences such as the UI which almost hides the scheduling feature several clicks deep -or the fact to change the "Comfort/Sleep/Eco" settings requires multiple clicks.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2024
Data: This device, although it has Nest in the name, is not compatible with the Nest app, or Nest temperature sensors. The finish is also mirror, which is definitely not represented in the product photos.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
Data:
It Won’t follow schedule I set. It was supposed to turn down to 69° at 9:45 PM and it didn’t.
Called tech support and they couldn’t fix it.
Very aggravating that’s such a simple function that a $20 thermostat can handle could not be done on this supposedly sophisticated device.
Also, the fan is supposed to run a certain amount of time after the AC compressor turns off and it doesn’t do that

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
Data:
I’m seriously struggling with this thermostat. I no longer control my home. Google does the scheduled thermostat times only adjust if Google thinks it’s appropriate or energy efficient. I have no idea if my thermostat will kick in at the time I programmed it to and my heating and cooling people recommend this thermostat, but if you’re hell-bent on saving money this is probably for you if you just wanna thermostat to program the way you want to get something else!
* This has been returned...

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
Data: I'm so tired of waking up to, or coming home to, a hot house. I've tried multiple methods to try to get my Nest to be a dumb thermostat, turning off presence sensing, scheduling, learning, etc. I've just gone through the settings again, killing every "smart" feature I could find. Another hot morning and I'll rip the Nest off the wall and install something from the 1970s. Nest needs to make it easier to prevent unwanted auto adjustments. Maddening.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2022
Data:
Waist of time trying to figure out app. It is NOT intuitive or beautiful. I truly cannot believe this is a name brand Google product. Guess some companies are best staying in their lane- and this is not it.
When trying to set preferred temperatures for sleep, eco, home and away modes you find yourself cycling through menus endlessly. The app seems to want to choose all these “preferences” and hide ways to adjust. Where are the user friendly graphics and swift adjustment options?
I am a graphic designer and fluent with all kinds of computer technologies. I have led trainings at work in new program and technology integration. Google nest is a bit too complex for me!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
Data: Despite being called a nest product. This will not pair with the nest app. So if you already have a nest device don’t buy this!!! Clearly they just want you to buy the more expensive product

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2021
Data: Before I say anything I will say I have a lot of knowledge and HVAC and electrical. I turned off all the fuses necessary, installed it twice and it still blew a fuse. Replace the fuse in my unit, turn the breakers back on and it worked. Then had problems with schedule. Did all my scheduling preferences and it would work for 24 hours and then go back to Eco. This thermostat does not care about you or what you want to do. It does what it wants you to do. Do not buy this product. The old model is better. Once it had “Google” in front of its name, the product downgraded.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2022
Data:
I had two Nest thermostats from 5 years ago in my former home. So I decided to purchase two of them for my current home. What a disaster. Installation was ore difficult, but tolerable. But the two BIG regressions were the software and the hardware. The Nest Software interface was fantastic. But of course Google had to instead make you use “Google Home” instead. What a significant downgrade in UX. I get that they want me to purchase more of their home automation products but they achieved the opposite. The hardware was just not as good either. I was a very happy Nest customer in the past.

But their product (hardware and software) as been ruined after the Google acquisition.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2023
Data: This thermostat is designed to decide when IT THINKS you are home and when you're away and is more focused on energy savings than your comfort or what heat and A/C settings you choose. I used it in my home for several months and was very disappointed and frustrated with it. I gave up and took it out. I replaced it with a Honeywell brand which I like much better. I wouldn't recommend the Nest thermostat to anyone. Another $100 wasted....

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
Data: Do not recommend. Every HVAC installer or smart tech installer I've talked to state that this product is junk. Has been a headache since purchasing, had to finally order the upgraded Next learning thermostat. Total joke!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
Data: Make sure this thing is compatible with your furnace. Took quite a while and a call to a friend in the heating and cooling industry to tell me that. Pretty much only works with newer equipment.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2023
Data: Set up took a while. Constantly looping back to the beginning asking me to do the same things over and over. And then eventually telling me to install it all the way even though it's already been installed. After about a half an hour I got it to work. It dose not work with sensors. The interface is horrible.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
Data: Thermostat is stuck on “Continue setup in the Google Home app”. I’ve been up messing with it for hrs trying to make it work. My wiring is correct. My Bluetooth is on on my phone and not connected to anything else. This product is just junk.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2022
Data: If you have a older home with no C wire, it keeps requiring you to have new equipment. I just wanted a simple thermostat that allowed me to program times and Geo tracking but all I got was a thermostat that just kept giving me errors until I bought more stuff for it. This thermostat is too reliant on power and Wi-Fi and is why I say it’s unsustainable. Let me clear Simple’s errors and just heat my house.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2023
Data: This did not work for me. I could not get it to work. I called a trusted heating and air technician over to install it. He said they are not good and knows of people who installed it and it broke there system. I returned it....

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2022
Data: I bought 2. One works great, one won't stay connected to WiFi even when I swap them. Google is useless, they say it's an issue with my router and I need to have someone come fix it. However, they completely dodge the fact my other works fine and has no issues even if I swap their locations. Bought them in November and have been dealing with this since. Amazon won't let me return, Google denies there is an issue until I pay some $200 to come out and tell me it's not my router.....how ironic.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
Data: This is the second Nest "Learning" thermostat that I've purchased. Google should "learn" to get out of the thermostat business because the SUCK at it. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
Data: I received this thermostat opened and the nails had paint and wall debri. On top of that, the manual was written on. Fingerprints on the actual thermostat. Ordered another one and it was the complete opposite. Unopened clean and no writing anywhere

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021
Data:
When you search "No C wire required," this is the first thing to come up and that's a lie. Nothing works on it without a C wire, unless you want to replace AAA batteries daily. And even still, the WiFi or none of the high end features work. Bought an adapter for 20 more bucks to provide C wire, but since there isn't a return slot, it didn't work as well.
So I'm sitting in a freezing cold house until a replacement can be found. Ugh.
So disappointed and frustrated, and none of it would have happened if they were just more honest.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
Data: The thermostat heats itself providing an inaccurate reading and causes the AC unit not to heat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2022
Data: Temp read in my house is was 100, when it was 28 degrees outside and my heat wasn’t working. It did not communicate with my unit properly and nearly had to replace the entire system that I just had installed 6 months ago. “High tech” technology is not always the way to go.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
Data: Received open box item that was resealed with scotch tape. If a used item was desired I would have purchased a used one and not paid for a new item.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2022
Data: The Google Nest has a mind of its own. We are in a winter storm right now trying to heat our house and everytime we try and turn up the heat. It will start heating and then just stop at whatever temperature it wants. Woke up to the house at 63 even though we set the temperature to 71. We will be switching back to our old thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2022
Data: I could not get past the very first step. I am not going to sign up for a new google email account just to make this thing work. I was NEVER sent a verification code to my current email to get the Google Home App to work in the first place. I have spent 2 hours on this, just does not work following the very limited installation instructions Also looks like you can no longer do returns at my local Whole Foods store?

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2022
Data: Save your money and time doesn't really do much more than the old digital thermostats. Heaven forbid if you need reconnect your nest to a new Wifi. Make sure you budget some time to deal with the poor interface and product design when you make this purchase.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
Data: These are awful took them down put my old Honeywell back up and added 2 new Honeywell too my new addition live the Honeywells these are a waste of money wish I could return them

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2022
Data: Sat in device setup limbo, ridiculous that the thermostat must be connected to the app before you can even pull up a menu, ecobee and others at least let you control the temp and connect to a network without even touching the app. Do not buy this model. Moving on to the ecobee, much better overall experience so far.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2021
Data: One of the main reasons I bought the nest was to be able to control my thermostat through my phone or tablet. Once a week I have to change the batteries and if you don’t change them your heater will not work.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2023
Data: Thermostat will not hold temperature steady. Eco mode can’t be deactivated. Control of the comfort of our home is not obtainable with this device. Wasted our money and will now have to find another thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
Data: Setup is simple but temp setting doesn’t work as expected. Tried resetting and did setup multiple times, that didn’t help.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2022
Data:
1. This is not intuitive.

2. There are three (3) available cycles. If you want to customize, you have to do it on demand. There is very little that is automatic about this thermostat.

3. I would not buy again and would definitely recommend that you look at other options.

I expected much more from Google.

Bought two Neat thermostats. can only get one to connect to Google Home app. Keeps saying I have to factory reset the unit to continue. I’m going back to Honeywell Wifi thermostats.

definitely not worth the money I thought i was saving.
