Data: There was no thermostat in the box.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2023
Data: No me gustó para nada

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
Data: This thermostat is easy to install. I elected to have a local HVAC specialist install it for me. Cost was $100. The thermostat is simple to install and there are help videos for installation. My thermostat worked fine as a thermostat, but neither I nor the HVAC installer could get the Nest Thermostat to connect to WIFI or to the Google Home App. The installer said this Nest Thermostat and the Google Home App that controls it are finnicky and he's had lots of calls for help to get them to work on the App. He said he could come back in a few days for no charge and spend more time trying to get the App to connect to the Nest Thermostat. I decided to return this one and buy a better Smart Thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2024
Data:
This thing was a major pain to install. You need to hire someone that really really knows about these things. Lots of wires and it took me 3 different people before I actually got it working. And the heater still only works on emergency heat and there is no option to have the system just circulate the air like my last Thermostat did

And because it took me 3 installers to get it working, I missed the window to get the rebate that I was supposed to get from my utility company.. which is the only reason I purchased it.. and I hate it.

It only gets 2 stars because at least I can control it from my phone and monitor usage.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
Data:
My biggest issue with this thermostat is that it does not support any features that will set an allowable temperature range that can be set, or a temperature lock feature. So it if very easy for a guest or a malicious actor to abuse your home’s HVAC system. Even my dusty old honeywell thermostat had this capability.

Otherwise it is a decent thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2024
Data: Absolutely crazy, but if you are hoping to keep using your Nest App dont get this Nest thermostat. You have to use google home. Crazy. Other than that its beautiful, easy to set up (in google home) and works as expected. But sheesh, unreal you cant use the app.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2024
Data: Thought this would be easier to use and replace another digital thermostat in our house. It worked for about a week but then it has an issue connecting with the electrical/recharge at the location. We’ve tried to troubleshoot but basically it would cost us $1000 to rewire the entire area. Very disappointing that it isn’t as easy as other thermostats.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2022
Data: I was excited to buy a Nest thermostat and install it. Installation wasn't too tough, but programming is a nightmare. This is a modern Generation X failure, absurdly complicated and impossible to program. When my every attempt to create a simple start, heat up, stop program failed, I called tech support. The guy I got clearly knew next to nothing about programming it; every time I asked a new question he put me on hold so he could look it up. The program he helped me create failed to do the simple tasks I wanted. Too many choices, zones, presets, just tech at its worst. I don't know why, but starting heating at 4:30 in the morning the office went from 56 degrees to 66 degrees in 5 hours. My maintenance guy put back the old Honeywell thermostat and this morning it was already at 72 degrees after an hour and a half. I will gladly give up the remote feature to have a properly warmed office.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2024
Data: Oder came in with Crack on the side but overall is a nice thermostat

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
Data: This is an updated review. My experience with this google nest thermostat has gotten worse. It comes on for 30 secs and shuts off for 3 minutes, constantly. The house doesn't cool off. I can't get in touch with an actual person for customer service. All they have is the troubleshooting guide that isn't helpful. I'm going back to the old fashioned thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2023
Data: The new thermostats are not nearly as intuitive as the older models but work OK. You cannot lock out the thermostat which having children would have been a deal breaker for me had I known but by far the worst part is that you can't use the old Nest app which was really good, you must use Google Home which is one of the worst apps I have seen since the early 2000's. It's as if the app is still in beta testing. The only reason to purchase this thermostat is if you want a Wi-Fi thermostat but do not have a C-wire connection.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2023
Data:
They redesigned the controls, there is a very counter intuitive control, is a slider touch sensitive on the right side, that you can't even see standing in front of it, so if you are a first time user, you should definitely read the stupid manual.

The control for the temperature and the menu, is a touch sensitive slider, people that have never encountered this design, have the hardest time using it, most of the time they give up, how do I know? Try running a rental unit with one of these, people won't stop calling you to figure out how to use the damn thing.

I hope whoever designed this gets fired, seriously.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
Data: The appearance is very nice and bland in great with my house modern design. However the installation process is very long and difficult to complete

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2023
Data:
Bought this for a lake house. Wanted to be able to raise the temperature in the house so it wasn’t cold when we got here.
It is constantly going back to 56 degrees when we are here. Or when I check it when we are not here, it will go back up to 69.
I have it set to home when here or away when not.
It obviously can’t learn and I want it to just STAY, to what I set it.
Bout ready to put old one back in, but I had professional do it and don’t want that expense, too!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2021
Data:
Google is ruining the Nest products. I bought this to add to my home that already has several Nest Learning and Nest Thermostat E thermostats. This one feels cheap and poorly engineered. The display looks and feels cheap and you have to slide your finger on the side to change the temperature vs. merely rotating the entire frame. The sliding does not work well and, as a result, changing the temp is challenging. Further, you cannot add this thermostat to the Nest app - you have to use Google Home and Google Home is just not as good as the Nest app in terms of features. Although Google has discontinued the Thermostat E for all but contractors, I was able to buy one and replace this one.

Either get the Nest Learning thermostat (expensive) or switch to Ecobee or another option.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2022
Data: Failed to perform Exactly what it's supposed to do. This device is designed to change your habits and change you comfort to what the climate changers want you to follow. It will not maintain a set temperature, instead, after setting the temperature, after 2-3 hours it'll change it to something "they" want you to maintain in you own home. You'll get tired of waking up in the middle of the night changing the temp back to your comfort temp. This device will fight you until you give in and follow "their" agenda....to reduce your "CO2" print.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2022
Data: This is a beautiful piece when it connects. I am constantly restarting the nest in order for it to reconnect to the app on the phone. When it’s connected, I am pleased for the convenience. Very sleek looking but again, I wish that the system would work better with the google app it requests you to use for set up. It defeats the purpose if I have to reset it daily rather than from the phone.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2022
Data: I have had this for a few months now and it will not work with the app on my phone. I have had others come look at it and try as well and this will not. Obviously this is not compatible. I wanted it so I could program it from my phone. The dial is very confusing to use. The swiping is very temperamental and not easy to use. I would not recommend. I will look for another brand that easier to program.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2022
Data: This has a nice appeal and looks great. But if there is not activity in the house it automatically goes into Eco mode. Not happy!! Maybe nice for a small condo but not a family with kids and pets

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2023
Data: I like the product, when it works, but the wifi chip failed after two weeks and months later I’m still waiting for google to replace the item as agreed after more than 90 minutes on the phone with customer service. I found many complaints about this on Nest forums.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2022

Programming the thermostat to change the temperature back is NOT enough if a person can take the thermometer offline.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2024
Data: Always seems to switch itself to Ecco mode and then you wake up in the middle of the night all sweaty. Keep turning Ecco off but I guess google wants to “save the world” by making my kids and I wake up in sweaty sheets

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2024
Data:
We have an older gen version of the nest that we love. Bought this version for my parents, and it was such a mess that after 6 months we took it out. The biggest problem was it is difficult to use, and not intuitive at all. As someone proficient in various tech - this was a struggle. And definitely a problem for my older parents. The Haptic Touch system didn’t always work correctly, causing a lot of headaches in toggling back and forth between menus. Generally it worked okay in the app - but only when it was properly connected to the WiFi.

Relatedly, the biggest problem was if the WiFi or electricity went out, it would not automatically reconnect. We installed this system in a vacation house - and if either of those issues occurred we were unable to control or change the temperature settings remotely, defeating the purpose of the wireless system.

Definitely do not recommend.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
Data:
I have two, and both always are low battery even tho they're powered by the AC all the time. No sensor support.
Google home integration is great th.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
Data: Don’t bother

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2023
Data: As others have mentioned, this product has major issues. I knew going in that it wasn’t the top of the line nest thermostat, but I expected it to work. First, the set up is widely frustrating. Can’t change the Wi-Fi without resetting the entire product. The app setting up only works half the time, making it even more complicated. You can’t turn the system off but leave the fan running, which EVERY other thermostat can do. So when my ac froze over, I had to turn the system off and melt rather than at least letting the fan running. It gets stuck on a temperature and does not move off it. I have temp sensors around my house and every one of them says it’s one temp, but the thermostat says something else. It gives inaccurate humidity readings, making me think I’m outside in alabama rather than inside. Overall it’s a poor product.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
Data:
Easy to operate and attractive.

The supporting app is cumbersome and requires a great deal of repetition to set all the times of day and all the rooms, even with some rudimentary copy and paste functionality.

Also aggressively asks to go on eco-friendly mode, where you'll be prohibited from going above 67 degrees. Decline once, it asks again. And again. And again. Strangely we've found a few that switched on eco-friendly mode, despite our persistent declining.

I have an infant, and this is expressly bad. We need it at 68 or higher. We just found the nursery had reverted to 67 without prompt.

Appreciate the push for the environment (though I'm betting Google is doing this for the sake of the energy company's bottom line) but this is a frustrating and ill-advised anti-pattern, and a deal-breaker for us.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
Data: We were given this thermostat by our electric company. Since it was installed, our power consumption has risen. We have tried to program it, set temps, set times and it still does it's own thing. We were receiving regular messages saying how much we were saving, but after I questioned them, we received no more messages.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
Data: I have an original Nest thermostat for the downstairs unit and it has worked great. I decided to add this unit to the upstairs. I chose this one to save a little money (mistake), as it was on sale when I purchased it. First issue was when I went to connect this unit to the Nest app I was redirected to use Google home. I wasn't all that thrilled to be required/ forced to use their app. Once it was setup in the Google Home app I noticed it kept changing the temperature on its own from the set perimeters and going to Eco mode which I had selected to disable during setup. After going back into Google Home I found there is no option for turning off Eco mode like in the actual Nest app. Went through the help feature looking for options to turn off Eco mode with no luck. Searched online thinking maybe I was crazy and found tons of people complaining about the same issue. Some claimed to be able to reset to factory settings and try again and that worked for them. I tried this with no luck. Overall, I would not recommend this product to anyone. Will be replacing with something else.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2022
Data: Setup was not bad, installation was not bad, the thermostat is not bad. But I have to replace batteries every month, which seems excessive

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2022
Data:
Nest advertises this thermostat is a Smart Thermostat, yet one of the most basic expected features is missing. I bought this thermostat for the specific purpose of having a way to limit the range of temperature guests could set at our short term rental; this came out of guests turning old thermostat down into the 50s. I bought this model as I did not need the learning features of the more expensive Nest Learning Model. As I have the Nest learning model at home and it is an excellent product with all the features one would expect, I assumed the only feature I would be giving up with this model was the learning capabilities. Sadly Google decided to hamstring this lower end model by not including basic functionality that even less expensive thermostats include by default. As far as design, the touch screen is a fingerprint magnet; you'll be cleaning this thing all the time.

Sadly Google would not take my units back as I no longer had the packaging; this has turned out to be an expensive experience. My advice, forget this Nest Model and either splurge on the Nest Learning or get a lower cost alternate brand that most likely has far more features.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2022
Data:
Before you purchase this device you need to understand that it requires a C line. If you do not have one, you will need to purchase and install one. It is not a simple process.Or you could have a professional do it for you (i.e. additional costs). If you attempt to install it without one, the app will tell you it is required and will not add the unit to your Google Home and will not be operational.

Even after your installation, there is a reasonable chance that if you loose power that the unit will not function correctly after the power comes back. My unit did not display the correct room temperature after such an outage. It read 12-15 degrees above the actual temp. After researching online, it seems this is not an uncommon problem with these units. In my attempt to repair this, the app ultimatly suggested I "restore to factory defaults" and reinstall it. After many hours and failed attempts, the app suggested I contact a professional and offerred me such a professional by simply clicking a button on the app. For an upfront cost of $129.

Ultimately, even the pro couldn't fix it. I now need to purchase a new unit altogether - after having spent ~$300 in total costs (the unit itself, the C-line, the pro who came but couldn't fix it) and many hours of my own time.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2022
Data: This thermostat's design is frustrating and not intuitive - rather than turning the whole thing like a dial, you have to swipe your finger somewhere on the side where you can't easily see, and then you have to tap the swiper-strip (that you can't see) to select things on the screen. Not tap on the screen on the front, like other devices that people may be accustomed to. My relatives have had to call me when I'm out of the house and they want to change it because they find it so confounding to use. The previous generation had a much more intuitive design, and I didn't realize I was buying something so different.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2022
Data: Purchased this from my local electric company for my basement. No NEST APP support and requiring the user to setup a separate home in the Google Home App removes multiple stars for me. This is terrible Google support for an otherwise good product. Do not purchase this product if you have Nest learning thermostats in your house.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2022
Data: I was swapping out a Nest Learning Thermostat with this base Nest model which went bad. The set up process was so unnecessarily hard and time consuming and I am a full fledge techie guy. The average person could be lost and it’s silly when Smart devices are supposed to be simple (basically). In the end Google Home came back and told me they weren’t sure my existing system would work and contact us if you have a problem…and then when I attempted to install it I got no response on the screen. At this point, it’s going back.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021
Data:
I've had several Nest Thermostats in the past and have only had amazing experiences. This is the first one I have purchased since Google got its hands on it and it was unusable for me.

You cannot use the "Nest" app anymore, its the Google Home app, which is not a great user experience.

The device itself feels much cheaper and and it feels like Google cut corners to mass produce this at a lower cost.

I bought two and immediately re-installed my previous thermostats. I won't even give these away to family or friends.

Data: Long, long story about the installation. Bottom line? Do a Google search for the pros and cons BEFORE you buy. An inordinate number of buyers have discovered installation is much more complex than you’re led to believe. In my case, I ended up calling two separate heating contractors and my total bill, in addition to the Nest, was $800.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2024

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2024
Data: Our HVAC tech told us to buy this when our Honeywell thermostat bit the dust. It's been a nightmare. We live in a hot and humid climate and no matter what we do, this thermostat keeps resetting itself to 82 degrees randomly. We've gone to every online forum we can find to figure out how to keep it from doing this and discovered that everyone has the same problem. So we have to constantly check it if we want our house cooler than 82 degrees - which we absolutely do. We sleep at 68 degrees and live at 72-75 degrees. It's very hard on your HVAC system to vary more than 3-5 degrees throughout the day so this is less than ideal. We do NOT recommend. We are having Honeywell thermostats reinstalled. Their app is easy to use and understand none of this nonsense.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2024
Data: I'd give the installation instructions and thermostat a passing grade but Google makes you install the Nest app and then the Home App and if you want to use the Alexa app, you need to go through several steps which I tried and could still not link it to Alexa. Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
Data:
Initial install
It went well other then when it came to adding to the google home app. The google home app kept failing to add it.

Batteries:
After two months of use I've had a couple power outages and each time it says batteries low this last time I took it off the wall. I looked at the batteries they say google on them they also say not rechargeable alkaline. Why have non rechargeable batteries seems like a engineering flaw. It couldn't have brought up the cost to make it charge after all the older Nest stuff did.

Google App:
Forces you to use google home instead of nest. if you ever had one of the older nest thermostats you will miss the nest app.

Things you cant do on this thermostat
Nest App: better scheduling also allowed you to login to the nest webpage to make changes.
Older nest thermostats allowed you to lock the physical to a temp range to keep the kids from getting ridiculous.

Other then the setup problems and the battery problems the product function as it should.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
Data:
The installation process was horrible. I felt bad my HVAC guy had to sit around for an hour just trying to figure out how to connect this thing to wifi.

The Google Home app freezes constantly and has glitches. This is really frustrating at times when you actually need an adjustment of temp.

The device looks nice and is fun to tap, but it’s not easy to use and takes some time to figure out.

I like the schedules you can set up and how you can add favorites like “home” “away” traveling” “sleep” “etc”. But I COULD NOT figure out how to turn my thermostat off when I was out of town for 2 weeks in the middle of summer which was very frustrating given no one needed my house to be cooled.

It’s a nice product but if I were to do this again, I would probably choose a more user friendly thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2024
Data: Controlling the nest from the product itself is hit and miss. The tap and slide method doesn't always work. Usually it takes 2 or 3 tries. Rarely do i get where I want to go on the first attempt. I try to use the app which is much more responsive.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
Data: It's a nice product but I have to ding it a couple of stars because after changing the password to my network the thermostat became disconnected. You would think it would be relatively straightforward to reconnect with the app. This is after all a Google product and surely they can design a simple way to reconnect a device to a wifi network. Surprisingly this is not the case. You have to remove the device from the app, rescan the QR, and then navigate to the wifi setup. Obviously this is not optimal but in my case even this didn't work and I had to do a factory reset before being able to reconnect to my network. In addition to the frustration and lost time all the thermostat usage data was lost. So if you don't think you'll ever be changing your wifi password this is close to a five star product but otherwise it's around three stars at best.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2024
Data: Appearance is sleek, looks good. Installation guide is easy and straight forward. Unfortunately, the “smart” aspects in daily life are quite annoying as the thermostat continuously changes the temperature on its own. I’ve reached out to google and looked up how to turn off these features but there are limitations to how much control you can have over it. The thermostat interface is laggy and often non-responsive, citing wifi connectivity as the problem. Too bad it can’t still function properly as a regular thermostat without wifi. There are definitely better “smart” thermostats out there that offer everything this does but also offer the main thing this one falls short of, which is being a thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2024
Data: This is a great easy to install thermostat if you have a single level home that's roughly a uniform temperature. If you have multiple levels to your home, or a room that gets much hotter/cooler than the rest, or your thermostat is not centrally located, this is not for you. You can NOT add temperature sensors to this unit. Not the Google Nest Temperature Sensors - despite the name! - not third party sensors, nothing. Buyer beware.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
Data: I got it because it was very cheap with my utilitie’s rebate. It’s nothing special. It does what every other smart thermostat does these days. What I don’t like is that it displays the set temperature in bold as opposed to the current room temperature. No option to change it. Also, no one can figure out how to adjust it without instructions. It’s not at all intuitive. No problem for the home owners, but guests will need lessons. If it didn’t say Google or Nest, I doubt it would be popular.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2022
Data:
Here is the best example of Not Ready: If you use the Help function within the app, you have to close the Help function to follow the directions of what to do. After you do Step 1, you have to re-open the Help function, re-ask your question to find Step 2 and then close the Help function to do Step 2. Repeat for each and every step. So basically, you have to go find a second device to read the Help steps or open a browser on your phone to look up the Help pages so that you can access the app at the same time. That's a completely non-functional use of the Help section within the app.

Tech suggestions are a pain to dig through because they often push you to pages that don't actully answer your question. Or, even though you have selected the correct thermostate out of three choices, it gives you steps that don't apply to YOUR thermostat.

The unit has repeatedly lost my wifi network, even when no other device does and the network and download speeds are fine. When trying to reconnect to wifi, it says it can't connect, even as I type this on the same wifi network.

This device is not ready for real-world usage.

Data: The reason I purchased this is for remotely controlling my home temperature to save energy. Most recent issue was that it would not go into energy saving mode when I was away. Here's the response from Nest/Google: " as we don't have the physical access to the thermostat, I request you to contact us back when you have access to the thermostat to help you further."

Will take time also figuring out the smart phone options just keep messing around wit the nest and you will adventully get it take your time. Data: Had to buy a replacement since my old one died a few months out of warranty. Besides that I've been pretty happy with it. However it's annoying that at this point Google/Nest haven't incorporated each other into their full suite of products, for example the Nest temperature sensors are only compatible with the other Google nest thermostats, the ones that use the Nest app as opposed to the google home app.

Date: Reviewed in Canada on December 25, 2022
Data: Bought this to be able to remotely adjust my parents thermostat while I am out of town. Installed and less than 24 hours started to malfunction. Had to drive out of my way to troubleshoot; it was actually dead batteries. New out of the box but was dead.

Date: Reviewed in Canada on December 21, 2022
Data: I was so excited to update my 1970s thermostat with this Nest. However, upon installation, I discovered you MUST have a c-wire for internal battery management. Theoretically you don't need one but if you do not connect a c-wire it will require changing the Triple A batteries approximately every 6 or 7 days. As I don't have AC, I moved my Y wire to be my C-wire the the support of a hired plumber. Once this was done, the internal battery would still not charge. I was never able to get the internal battery to read over 3.6V which is apparently the critical voltage for the unit to be able to keep full functionality. THEN it dawned on me that even if I could get the internal charging properly when the HVAC system turned on, because I live in a 4 season climate and I don't have AC, I would not be using the system AT ALL for 4 to 5 months of the year. The battery would surely be dead after one summer if I did not keep putting Triple A batteries in it every week (because you cannot turn this unit off to conserve battery) and there is no USB charge option on this unit!! I would have a 130 dollar purchase that got me through ONE winter, if this is the case. Therefore I returned it and will look for some other options. However, if you are able to address these battery issues, then the unit is really nice and the functionality is actually quite slick. GOOD LUCK!

Date: Reviewed in Canada on May 13, 2022
Data: I have three gen 2 Nests and they are sooooo much better.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2022
Data:
I replaced and existing Wi-fi Enabled Honeywell that never worked very well. Overall the Nest Thermostat it’s a very positive upgrade : better aesthetics , better UI and much better “smart” features meaning i am saving money right away.

If you are a Google Home / Nest user then there is a lot of added value due to the automation and reporting features . The home and away detection using Google Home App works well to reduce usage while you are away from home. the daily reporting helps you estimate your bill. and the scenario-based scheduling gives you useful control over heating to balance comfort and usage

There are some failures though . the initial wire detection failed , i believe due to firmware issues . also my furnace has a semi automated fan, so the green wire detection failed while the timed fan was enabled . after 3 iterations the setup completed fine and the unit has been working great . Once active, my furnace now cycles less frequently which reduces noise in the house

the device UX is great but not intuitive for guests . yet another “one click does everything “ UI that takes time to understand . This could be good if you don’t want guests to fiddle

Finally, the Google HOME UI is very clumsy for basic features like setting schedules and reading the temperature . the app has too many features and functions that get in the way of basic thermostat usage . I recommend commanding via google assistant or setting hold temperature via the Device UI. Once you set a schedule , you won’t be adjusting temps often so it’s a minor hindrance .

Overall it’s a very positive purchase and with the rebate and cost savings you’ll save at least $100 in the first year . It’s a classy device —easily the best looking Thermostat on the market with the glossy mirrored finish and high contrast display .

All in I highly recommend it with some reservations that will likely be cleaned up with software revisions . If you are eligible for a rebate or a heavy Google user, it’s an obvious upgrade to pursue

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2024
Data:

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
Data:
I have an AC and heat pump with backup heat. This thermostat doesn’t support backup/emergency heat which I didn’t know when I bought it. Still works for heat and AC but if you want the assurance of everything hooked up then you’ll need the “learning thermostat” version.
Pros:
Good home/away sensing and easy to use in the Google home app. One tap enrollment in electric supplier rebates.
Cons:
Terrible controls on the actually thermostat. They couldn’t have picked a worse interaction method than sliding and tapping the side. Please just put buttons or an actually moving ring smh. But I usually just use my phone or Google home to adjust it.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2024
Data:
The theromstat itself is great. Easy to hook up and get up and running. Very easy to use.
The only problem is the app control. You have to use Google home app to work it, which is fine but Google home does not refresh every time you open the app. Even with background app refresh on the app opens to its last settings of temperatures. You have to close the app and reopen it everytime to get it to update the current settings and temps. There is a Google nest app but that app is not compatible with this Google nest product. That makes no sense. Both Google nest thermostat and the app are made by Google and supported by Google yet the Google nest app does not work this thermostat. A dedicated app to the nest unit would be nice instead of having to use Google home app which is an overall app and not dedicated to the nest unit. Google home needs to refresh when you open the app

I think I can order an additional part to cover it up but I have no idea honestly.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2022
Data:
I really liked the presentation of this device, it is clean and well built, although the software is atrocious. Google Home is so convoluted that make you feel an idiot because all you want to do is set up the thermostat temperature range.

By default the device require wifi to even activate; but the process is simple. Overall you will have hard time depending if your AC/heater has the blue wire or not (which is the one carrying the power from what I can understand reading comments online). This device has its own set of batteries but I had hard time setting up my system because it was complaining that a wire was not set (yellow; which was set); so reading online I found that the software require the blue wire connected/shorted to be physically connected to the device, for the system to work. Please check online about this issue and you will find very detailed instructions about how to solve it.

Clearly the issue is purely on the software side: the app ask you to tell how many wires you have, so you need to connect the blue wire but tell the app you do not have it connected; and magically the thermostat will work. YMMV depending on your AC/heater system of course; they have different number of wires so check with someone knowledgeable.

Other than that; setting up a simple range of temp for the whole day was a challenge, because this thing is so smart that it think that you need 4 different setup for different time of the day, as if you want to keep your temperature constant. After a lot of jumps and hoops, I was able to keep the bloody thing in a range where it turn on only when it is too hot or too cold, and stay off the rest of the time.

Also not sure why the option to set a range is disabled by default, but I assume it is because people use those for AC only and not for heating and AC combo? My system has a combo for AC and heater so I needed the setting that turn on heater when too cold, and AC when too hot; and had to dig in the settings to change this, while it should be a simple option right on the main app page.

The controls on the unit are OK; there are no buttons and the screen is not touch screen, you have a strip on the right side which is hard to use unless you got some sort of dexterity or your fingertips are super conductive I guess. I am a tech person for living and this interface was quite weird to handle; would rather have 3 buttons to do everything instead of the strip but once you know how to handle the device, it is usable.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
Data:
This thermostat is excellent when integrated with Google Home. Using the new script editor feature, we have nearly full control over the settings based on any trigger we like.

The in-app temperature scheduling works well.

The only thing missing is full control over the fan. The fan scheduling options are limited to running it every day, between a start and end time, and running it for a specific duration in each hour. For example, you can schedule it between 2pm to 8pm by running it for 15 minutes every hour, or for "60 minutes every hour", which basically enables it full-time.

The fan cannot be enabled or disabled with automation so there's no ability to:

- Turn off the fan when home presence is away.
- Enable the fan when home presence is home.
- Enable the fan when upstairs is much hotter than downstairs.
- Etc.

The fan can be manually turned on or turned on via the app, but it has to be for a specific amount of time, like 30 minutes, 8 hours, etc.

We've accepted that we will have to manage the fan ourselves by manually turning it on when needed.

Overall, a great product that is really cheap when combined with rebates. It would be excellent if it supported better control on the fan.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2023
Data: I was a little surprise when I got my Nest. I did a search for the e-nest which is one down from the top of the line. This is what came up in my search. But it's not what I got. I got the bottom line basic nest unit. It works pretty well does everything it is supposed to but it does not have all the bells and whistles of the two more expensive thermostats. One you cannot turn the bezel to adjust the temperature, you must sweep your finger along a line on the side. It works, but I did not expect this. Second when doing the installation it's pretty straightforward but I could not find an installation for this model. All the Google Home installation directions took me to the Top Line or the one lesser model. Also this does not come with a bezel plate for behind it. Unless your wall is pristine with a hole no bigger than about an inch and a half across you are going to have to put an escutcheon plate behind the mounting bracket. Not a problem, just a surprise. Also I ran into a couple of configuration issues when doing the self test however I just pushed Skip and everything worked. Overall it wasn't too difficult just a bit surprising.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2021
Data:
First of all you do not need a C wire. Yes it is recommended. It would give you unlimited power and no need for batteries. I have 2 units running for a year now without a C wire. I recently changed the batteries proactively even though the units did not indicate a need.

They come without in the box instructions. My knee-jerk reaction was to pack it up and send it back, but I decided to use the app and proceed that way. That works just fine. Installation is simple. I took it slow making sure I followed everything exact so if anything went wrong it wasn't user error.

Outside of my phone and TV I don't have a lot of respect for smart devices. My home is filled with them. Mostly useless things like my smart dishwasher, stove, and washing machine, that simply tell me when they're done. Is that really smart? This smart device is and you need it.

The setup of the device and app is doable even for a noob. Those who wrote how hard it is probably had other issues.

Why do you need a smart thermostat? 1) Not needing to adjust the temps when you leave the house is big. 2) When that cold snap happens, not waking up to a freezing house is another. 3) It is nice to know how much the heat and air run. Just knowing that might influence your habits.

Why you don't need a smart thermostat. You don't need to adjust your home's temps while you are away. Not really. You've already programmed it that when you're gone, and it knows you're gone, it will lower go into eco mode. You don't need to check the temps. But if that makes a thrill run up your spine guess what? This thermostat can do that.

There are some nice eco reports that this Nest generates as well. I like these but they are like infotainment. They are interesting, but I'm not going to act on them. I want the temperatures a certain way in my house (I work out of my home too) and my computer gear must be kept cool. But it did influence how I set my eco mode and made me power down my computers while away and at night to conserve energy.

I have 2 of the same model. One on each level. One of them crashes every few days in a peculiar way. It stops logging eco data and becomes unresponsive to the app, but still reports being connected to the network and continues to function properly. Resetting it restores function. I haven't contacted CS because I just don't want to spend the time.

This is odd and very hard to troubleshoot and the only reason I am deducting a star. The same issue has happened to the other unit but only 3 times in a year. Both have very strong wifi connections.

Full disclosure, I purchased though my power company and not from Amazon.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2021

Date: Reviewed in Canada on August 17, 2022
Data:
The thermostat is good looking, with the neat mirror finish and a bright easy to read display. It was also relatively easy to install, however this location was already previously set up with a Lyric smart thermostat so all necessary provisions were already present including the C-wire.

Actually doing stuff on the thermostat itself is not a great experience, you would think that it has touch sensors all around the outside and you would "spin" your hand around the edge like other Nest models, but no only the right side registers touch and is very finicky at that. Sometimes swipes register, sometimes taps to select register, but other times they don't. Thankfully however, aside from initial setup, the rest of controlling afterwards can be done via your phone instead.

App functionality works great, the unit has very stable WiFi connection, and there is a lot of features and scheduling functionality within the Google Home app that if you're somewhat competent at tech (specifically smart home and using Google's app) isn't too hard to figure app. It's much better than trying to do things via the thermostat's controls.

Date: Reviewed in Canada on October 17, 2022
Data: My condo had instructions for the older version of this the thermostat so I thought, how hard could it be to install? HARD. Sooo unnecessarily difficult. Basically Google doesn’t want you to install it yourself. My old thermostat didn’t have labels which might have been part of the issue. If yours does then the Google Home app will walk you through what goes where. I wasn’t especially impressed with the Google app for setting default temperatures, it’s really not user friendly. I’d recommend starting with the defaults and adjusting once it’s set up. Now that I’ve gotten past all that it’s all I could ask for. It does look nice. I didn’t realize “fog” was the green colour but I really like it. It’s just getting through the installation, that may kill you.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2022
Data: I was dreading installing this. Thought to myself - I am handy but am I that handy?! Was putting off purchasing because I was thinking install would be a nightmare! Electric and plumbing - both Ararat’s make me pause… My house was built in 2016 so not that old. I have no idea how much harder install it like be if you own an older home. Picture of the inside of my old Honeywell thermostat is attached / one of those just regular standard thermostats. I did check comparability prior to purchase - seemed ok. I read the instructions first and followed them precisely! And it was easy actually. Took about 30 minutes which included taking the old one off as well. Works great as expected / anticipated / described. Word of advice- do this in the day time and good lighting. Or have someone hold a flashlight while you are installing. You are going to be turning off the power prior to the install, so you need another source of light to see what you are doing. All in all good experience so far. I need to patch up a small hole where the old thermostat was but not a big deal - see picture. Recommend purchasing. And I think this is my longest review ever. Maybe lol.

I do have a “Blue C Common” wire that I had installed for the Gen 2 as it would battery drain all the time. This screen is super bright FYI, don’t let the mirror fool you it’s very clear and bright!

This new one was installed, firmware updated, up and running no lie in like 15 minutes, I am a little disappointed it was so easy as my wife looked at me and said “that’s it ?” If you’re wondering this is the Fog Color and my wall is painted Sherwin Williams “Anew Gray” and they pair well together.

We have a few nest cameras around the house and it’s good to now be able to use the same home app for everything.

I am glad I took advantage of this sale, couldn’t be happier with the new Thermostat!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021
Data: I'm a bit mystified by the number of reviewers complaining about the lack of installation instructions or needing a C wire. The Google Home app takes you through installation step-by-step. Installation is basically this: turn off the HVAC circuit breakers, remove old thermostat making sure to label the wires as you disconnect them, connect the wires to the same terminal letters as the old thermostat, pull the Nest battery plastic barrier to allow batteries to make contact, turn the circuit breakers back on, and then use the Google Home app to set the thermostat controls. I have a relatively new Trane HVAC gas system which uses wires G, Y, W, and R. The Nest works fine with no C wire. The entire process to remove and replace the thermostat took about 35 minutes. The only additional requirement is installing the Nest thermostat skill on Alexa if you want to allow voice control of the Nest through Alexa. It's a great thermostat. The Google Home app allows simple setup. With Alexa, it's easy to override any presets simply by telling Alexa to change the temperature or to switch from heating to cooling, or vice versa. A nice feature of the Nest is that when you set whatever temperature you want at a given time, the thermostat will pre-heat or cool so the target temperature is achieved when the specified time is reached. In case you're concerned about what happens in the event of an internet outage, don't be. The thermostat retains all of its settings and can be changed manually on the thermostat itself should you experience an internet outage. Finally, the thermostat temperature precisely matches two other accurate temperature gauges I tested it against.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2024
Data:
Everything about this thermostat is a downgrade from the other Nest thermostats. I have had every version of the Nest thermostat and this one is the worst.

1) The controls are less intuitive. The spinning wheel is what made the Nest thermostat so easy to use and is the reason why the circle shape worked. If you remove the spinning to navigate the thermostat, what is the point of it being round like this? Instead, you have to use a touch-sensitive panel on the side which uses swipe and tap gestures. It sucks.

2) The app is a downgrade. You can no longer use the more intuitive Nest app. You have to use the Google Home app with this thermostat which requires more taps and searching through menus for simple control.

3) The colors are pretty, but it actually looks cheaper than the Nest Learning Thermostat or Nest Thermostat E. In my opinion, the best looking and most functional model was the E, which they have discontinued for reasons which baffle me.

5) I guess when we received it the battery was very low. It's been months of seeing "Very Low Battery" on the screen. Yes, I will replace the battery (a AAA), but it should come with a battery that has some charge. Not a good luck to ship things which, when first powered on, immediately says the battery needs to be replaced. Besides, if it's Low Battery as the screen has indicated for months now... why is it continuing to operate for this long?

Sadly, we will be looking to other brands for thermostats once we finally get frustrated enough with this one. Besides, Google sells your personal data and profits from it. Best I avoid supporting that in the future anyways: and so should you.

I recommend passing on the Nest Thermostat if you like simplicity, function, and style.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2024
Data:
We have an older gen version of the nest that we love. Bought this version for my parents, and it was such a mess that after 6 months we took it out. The biggest problem was it is difficult to use, and not intuitive at all. As someone proficient in various tech - this was a struggle. And definitely a problem for my older parents. The Haptic Touch system didn’t always work correctly, causing a lot of headaches in toggling back and forth between menus. Generally it worked okay in the app - but only when it was properly connected to the WiFi.

Relatedly, the biggest problem was if the WiFi or electricity went out, it would not automatically reconnect. We installed this system in a vacation house - and if either of those issues occurred we were unable to control or change the temperature settings remotely, defeating the purpose of the wireless system.

Definitely do not recommend.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
Data: This thermostat is easy to install. I elected to have a local HVAC specialist install it for me. Cost was $100. The thermostat is simple to install and there are help videos for installation. My thermostat worked fine as a thermostat, but neither I nor the HVAC installer could get the Nest Thermostat to connect to WIFI or to the Google Home App. The installer said this Nest Thermostat and the Google Home App that controls it are finnicky and he's had lots of calls for help to get them to work on the App. He said he could come back in a few days for no charge and spend more time trying to get the App to connect to the Nest Thermostat. Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024
Data:
My biggest issue with this thermostat is that it does not support any features that will set an allowable temperature range that can be set, or a temperature lock feature. So it if very easy for a guest or a malicious actor to abuse your home’s HVAC system. Even my dusty old honeywell thermostat had this capability.

Otherwise it is a decent thermostat.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2024
Data:
The theromstat itself is great. Easy to hook up and get up and running. Very easy to use.
The only problem is the app control. You have to use Google home app to work it, which is fine but Google home does not refresh every time you open the app. Even with background app refresh on the app opens to its last settings of temperatures. You have to close the app and reopen it everytime to get it to update the current settings and temps. There is a Google nest app but that app is not compatible with this Google nest product. That makes no sense. Both Google nest thermostat and the app are made by Google and supported by Google yet the Google nest app does not work this thermostat. A dedicated app to the nest unit would be nice instead of having to use Google home app which is an overall app and not dedicated to the nest unit. Google home needs to refresh when you open the app

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2024
Data:
My AC doesn't natively have a control wire. I bought a 24 adapter, wired it up, eventually got it working. Then after an hour, it started reading 10 degrees hotter than it actually was. Then 20 degrees hotter. I had this same problem with another Nest thermostat, and pulling the batteries fixed it (for a while). I pulled the batteries of this unit, then it wouldn't reconnect to wifi. Overnight, it ran and ran and ran and I woke up to 60F house instead of the normal 70F.

If you have two separate systems for AC and Heat, you need two Nest (so I've wasted money twice); and you need to create different locations in the Google Home app because I guess you can't have two Nest thermostats in the same location for some reason.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2024
Data: Two things that caused me to return this product in day 1: no fan control when unit is not in heat or cool mode. Also setup was a joke. It never recognized all of the connected wires. First it didn't recognize the red wire. I did it over and over, trimming and reinserting. Finally did a factory reset. Without doing a thing, now the red wire was recognized, but not the Common wire. This meant I couldn't even start the HVAC unit. Fiddled and fiddled with that to no avail. After a number of resets and retries with no success, I took it off the wall, packaged it back up, and asked for AA refund.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2024
Data:
This thermostat is very difficult to set up since there is some kind of software bug that gives you an Error code 294 if you have 4 wires from the heater/AC (without C wire). After getting no help from Nest customer support I finally found a workaround on the Google Nest community website. The trick is to set the system up for 5 wire and then reset it when it complains that the C wire is missing.

I still have a problem with Home ans Away feature not working. After spending 2 hours on the phone with level 1 customer support I was promised a call back from level 2 support . It has been 3 days and the only response that I get every time I email them is someone is going to call you right back. But, of course, nobody does.

Horrible customer service!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2024
Data: We purchased two of these for our new home to replace Honeywell thermostats that we thought were difficult. After three hours of attempting to program through the app on our phones, we finally had to wait for our son to come visit so he could install them. He is extremely tech savvy and it took him two hours to load onto one phone. We would like to have had them on two phones but apparently that is not an option. After YouTube videos and about two hours, I managed to set a schedule for the winter with the heat coming on at certain time and going off at a certain time. We have now switched into spring, and are in need of some AC and after again, hours of struggling through the app on our phone, and YouTube videos, no matter what we set one of our ACs to it kept coming on heat, even though we had it on the cool setting and at 70. It was 76° in the house so it should’ve cooled but instead it just kept giving us heat. We finally just shut the breaker off for that AC so that our house wouldn’t be 80° before we had company arriving. Yesterday we removed it and put the Honeywell back in, and are very glad of it simplicity. My advice is that these are not very user-friendly at all. Unfortunately, we are two months past our return date so an expensive lesson. Hope this helps you not make the same mistake that we did.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
Data:
Cutting right to the chase, I hate this thermostat. It has made a process I've never spent more than a moment thinking about (setting the temperature in my home) into a nightmare of reading and re-reading the directions then ending up exasperated because this won't do the simplest thing any thermostat should do- stay at the temperature you set.
Yes, you read that right. You cannot set and forget the temp for more than 24 hours. So let's say you plan for an upcoming coldsnap by leaving your upstairs at 65 degrees, which is a comfortable sleeping temp and a bit chilly in the day but nonetheless a temp that won't have your heat pump running constantly or worse yet, going into emergency heating mode. Don't get me started on what it'll do when we go on vacation.
I find myself waking in the middle of the night, or closing my eyes to go to sleep only to realize that yes, once again I need to set and hold the temp otherwise it will jump up to some preset temperature based upon what? I have no idea. If "eco" mode is chosen there is no way to adjust those temps either. Apparently Nest believes they know what eco means more than the homeowner does.
My newer more advanced Nest thermostat downstairs also has eco mode but it can be adjusted to hold a temp and supposedly it "learns" whatever that means.
Since replacing a Honeywell digital thermostat with this monster my utility bills increased by 1/3! Can I prove it's due to this device? No I cannot. But I can sure suspect it.
Worse than the old fully manual thermostats with mercury switches, IMO not matter how much your local utility discounts them I would steer clear of this model.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
Data:
Terrible app!

1) can’t set indefinite hold, only holding certain temp presets.
2) app is buggy, have to close it and open it again to change temp (on iPhone 15 pro max and wife’s 14 pro max)
3) can’t set schedules at any time, has to be on the half hour or hour. Want the thermostat to set heat to 70 at 6:45? Too bad. Pick 6:30 or 7.
4) air conditioning fan blowout (and heat blowout) doesn’t work. It’s toggled on, but when AC unit turns off, so does the furnace. Every other thermostat I’ve ever had will continue to blow for 3-5 minutes to take advantage of Still cool coils, but not in this app! Same with heat.

Overall, Google is way out of their element here. Way too big to be effective in building a thermostat app that’s responsive and works well.

I’ve provided countless feedback for 2+ years to their teams, and nothing ever changes. The new Honeywell unit arrives Friday, and I can’t rip this thing out fast enough. Absolute garbage.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
Data:
Initial install
It went well other then when it came to adding to the google home app. The google home app kept failing to add it.

Batteries:
After two months of use I've had a couple power outages and each time it says batteries low this last time I took it off the wall. I looked at the batteries they say google on them they also say not rechargeable alkaline. Why have non rechargeable batteries seems like a engineering flaw. It couldn't have brought up the cost to make it charge after all the older Nest stuff did.

Google App:
Forces you to use google home instead of nest. if you ever had one of the older nest thermostats you will miss the nest app.

Things you cant do on this thermostat
Nest App: better scheduling also allowed you to login to the nest webpage to make changes.
Older nest thermostats allowed you to lock the physical to a temp range to keep the kids from getting ridiculous.

Other then the setup problems and the battery problems the product function as it should.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
Data:
I absolutely loved my nest for the first two years I have had it. It did occasionally disconnect from the wifi, but was easy to reconnect. The warranty on it went out about 6 months ago, and for the last three months it has decided to go haywire.

Every so often, the thermostat decides that it is not connected to any power system and refuses to operate the HVAC system. I have had my regular HVAC guys (who installed the current HVAC only a few years ago) come over and check the system, and they found nothing wrong with it. They both said they did not like google nest thermostats because they can cause tons of issues, but mine seemed to be working perfectly fine at the time of them checking everything.

I had not had any issue with it until this passed Thursday night, when I woke up because it was cold in my house. I went to turn up the heater through the app, but noticed the HVAC was not coming on. I got up and tried to turn the heat up manually, but the thermostat stated it was not connected to power and gave error code E298. This was the code I also got a few months ago when I had this issue the first time. I turned the switch off at the HVAC for the remainder of the weekend, as I was out of town and knew it would not get cold enough to warrant the heater turning on while I was away. I have attempted 4 times tonight (Sunday) to get the thermostat to connect to power, but to no avail. I will be buying a new thermostat of a different brand first thing tomorrow morning.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2024
Data: This product is great it works with my HVAC system to get the most out of it. I really like that I can control it from my phone.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2024
Data: Connects easily to our existing Google Nest system. Installation was easy and only took a few minutes. Make sure you understand your existing wiring before you start and this is an easy replacement for your existing thermostat. Being able to adjust settings ing the Google home program makes it very convenient to use.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2024
Data:
Everything about this thermostat is a downgrade from the other Nest thermostats. I have had every version of the Nest thermostat and this one is the worst.

1) The controls are less intuitive. The spinning wheel is what made the Nest thermostat so easy to use and is the reason why the circle shape worked. If you remove the spinning to navigate the thermostat, what is the point of it being round like this? Instead, you have to use a touch-sensitive panel on the side which uses swipe and tap gestures. It sucks.

2) The app is a downgrade. You can no longer use the more intuitive Nest app. You have to use the Google Home app with this thermostat which requires more taps and searching through menus for simple control.

3) The colors are pretty, but it actually looks cheaper than the Nest Learning Thermostat or Nest Thermostat E. In my opinion, the best looking and most functional model was the E, which they have discontinued for reasons which baffle me.

5) I guess when we received it the battery was very low. It's been months of seeing "Very Low Battery" on the screen. Yes, I will replace the battery (a AAA), but it should come with a battery that has some charge. Not a good luck to ship things which, when first powered on, immediately says the battery needs to be replaced. Besides, if it's Low Battery as the screen has indicated for months now... why is it continuing to operate for this long?

Sadly, we will be looking to other brands for thermostats once we finally get frustrated enough with this one. Besides, Google sells your personal data and profits from it. Best I avoid supporting that in the future anyways: and so should you.

I recommend passing on the Nest Thermostat if you like simplicity, function, and style.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2022
Data:
I replaced and existing Wi-fi Enabled Honeywell that never worked very well. Overall the Nest Thermostat it’s a very positive upgrade : better aesthetics , better UI and much better “smart” features meaning i am saving money right away.

If you are a Google Home / Nest user then there is a lot of added value due to the automation and reporting features . The home and away detection using Google Home App works well to reduce usage while you are away from home. the daily reporting helps you estimate your bill. and the scenario-based scheduling gives you useful control over heating to balance comfort and usage

There are some failures though . the initial wire detection failed , i believe due to firmware issues . also my furnace has a semi automated fan, so the green wire detection failed while the timed fan was enabled . after 3 iterations the setup completed fine and the unit has been working great . Once active, my furnace now cycles less frequently which reduces noise in the house

the device UX is great but not intuitive for guests . yet another “one click does everything “ UI that takes time to understand . This could be good if you don’t want guests to fiddle

Finally, the Google HOME UI is very clumsy for basic features like setting schedules and reading the temperature . the app has too many features and functions that get in the way of basic thermostat usage . I recommend commanding via google assistant or setting hold temperature via the Device UI. Once you set a schedule , you won’t be adjusting temps often so it’s a minor hindrance .

Overall it’s a very positive purchase and with the rebate and cost savings you’ll save at least $100 in the first year . It’s a classy device —easily the best looking Thermostat on the market with the glossy mirrored finish and high contrast display .

All in I highly recommend it with some reservations that will likely be cleaned up with software revisions . If you are eligible for a rebate or a heavy Google user, it’s an obvious upgrade to pursue
